item.title: Encryption, Biometrics, and the Status Quo Ante
item.description: Published: July 2015 URL: https://www.lawfareblog.com/encryption-biometrics-and-status-quo-ante Abstract: As the recent indirect debate between FBI Director James Comey and co-blogger Susan Landau makes clear, the underlying premises of the encryption issue are highly contested. The Senate will continue the debate this week with a hearing before the Judiciary Committee on July 8 at which our own Herb Lin (among others) will testify and another hearing before the Intelligence Committee.

item.title: New Perspectives on the Future of Encryption
item.description: Published: May 2019 URL: https://www.lawfareblog.com/new-perspectives-future-encryption Abstract: Encryption and its effects on law enforcement’s access to data seem to occupy a perennial place in the headlines (and on Lawfare as well). The two of us have been working on it for years. The subject is often highly contested, but the fierce discussion has ignored some critical factors. One of those is how changing usage patterns and technologies will affect how law enforcement can—or can’t—obtain access.
